description.default:
Communicate with Serial/COM port compatible devices, such as Arduino.
When you open the serial port, plugin generates "Serial.Received" event with port name in payload {1} and message in payload {2} every time device sends message on port. This event can be disabled in plugin options window.

Opens and selects first port with name matching the <Port name RegEx pattern>. If you want to select one from list of opened ports, you can omit parameters starting from 2. After opening port you can handle incoming messages with "Serial.Received" event. Actions "Close", "Write" and "Micro.Upload" will work with port, selected by this action.

parameter.name: Message to send on selected port.

description.default: Sends a message on selected port.

info.parameter: Path to sketch in .HEX format (MUST NOT CONTAIN "with_bootloader")

description.default:
[Asynchronous action] Uploads sketch in ".hex" format to Arduino board on selected port. You need to have Arduino IDE for this action.
Supported models (Case insensitive): UnoR3, NanoR3, Micro, Mega1284, Mega2560.
How to make .hex file from .ino or .pde sketch?
- In Arduino IDE menu, choose "Sketch" -> "Export Compiled Binary", or type Ctrl+Alt+S;
- Then go to Sketch -> Show Sketch Folder. 2 .hex files will appear in your sketch folder.
IMPORTANT: To upload sketch on Arduino, select .hex file, which name does NOT contain "with_bootloader".
